thread.title: Gomez, Underwood to perform at American Music Awards
thread.title_full: Gomez, Underwood to perform at American Music Awards

title: Gomez, Underwood to perform at American Music Awards
text:
Updated: 8:53 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 | Posted: 8:53 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 Gomez, Underwood to perform at American Music Awards Related View Larger FILE - In this Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, file photo, Selena Gomez performs on NBC's "Today" show at Rockefeller Plaza in New York. Gomez, Carrie Underwood and 5 Seconds of Summer will be performing at the American Music Awards, on Nov. 22, 2015, at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. (Photo by Charles Sykes/Invision/AP, File) View Larger FILE - In this Aug. 16, 2015, file photo, Luke Hemmings, from left, Ashton Irwin, Michael Clifford and Calum Hood, of 5 Seconds of Summer, arrive at the Teen Choice Awards at the Galen Center, in Los Angeles. Selena Gomez, Carrie Underwood and 5 Seconds of Summer will be performing at the American Music Awards, on Nov. 22, 2015, at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP, File) View Larger FILE - In this June 10, 2015, file photo, Carrie Underwood performs at the CMT Music Awards at Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tenn. Selena Gomez, Underwood and 5 Seconds of Summer will be performing at the American Music Awards, on Nov. 22, 2015, at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. (Photo by Wade Payne/Invision/AP, File) Sponsored Links The Associated Press LOS ANGELES â€” 
Selena Gomez, Carrie Underwood and 5 Seconds of Summer will be performing at the American Music Awards. 
Dick clark productions announced Wednesday that the pop acts will each take the stage at the Nov. 22 show at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. All three have new albums out this month. 
Show host Jennifer Lopez is also set to perform at the ceremony, which will be broadcast live on ABC. 
Taylor Swift leads nominees with six bids, followed by Ed Sheeran and The Weeknd with five each. Nominations are based on sales, airplay and social media activity. Fans select the winners by voting online. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
